title: How To Live With A Woman For The First Time (w/Gus Sorola) - Love & Sex Stuff
description:

It is much easier than you'd think.

Each and every Monday at 9AM PST Tim Gettys and Nick Scarpino answer your questions about dating and relationship advice....cause that sounds like a good idea.


Follow us on Twitter!
Gus Sorola - https://twitter.com/sorola
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Nick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_Scarpino



Music by Tonedeff - http://www.QN5.com

transcript_chunks.text: I need my space so G Nick today's question comes from 24-year-old Julian Julian says hey I'm about to get married and for the first time ever live with this woman how do I live with a woman that's a question that's it that's it that's all that's all you guys are pros at this you've been doing it for a long time yeah I've been married uh almost 10 years now so uh the for a few years um it's it's I mean I I don't like I need a little more context like has this person had a roommate cuz it's not like it's not like a scary it's not dissimilar from having a roommate that's very true it's it's it's it's a roommate that you share a bed with I mean it's not a scary monster you're that that was that's the thing when I first got engaged see I I moved in with my wife once we got engaged so I gave her the ring did the whole thing and I was like let's moving together we started Furnishing and I was terrified the first day I actually it was the weirdest thing I had this weird anxiety when I

gave her the ring did the whole thing and I was like let's move in together, we started furnishing and I was terrified the first day. I actually, it was the weirdest thing. I had this weird anxiety when I was going to walk through the door for the first time to this new relationship, this new life. And I walked in, got up the balls to actually like open the door, go get a taco and I went and I walk into the apartment and nothing changed. Honestly, if you're in a good relationship with someone and you guys have an actual healthy relationship where you know you can talk and communicate and figure stuff out together, and nothing will change when you guys actually move in. I think the biggest adjustment I had um when you know I first started living with my wife was trying to you know realize that even though we're spending time together cuz we're you know we're living together, that it's okay to go and do something without the other person at like at the time

trying to you know realize that even though we're spending time together cuz we're you know we're living together that it's okay to go and do something without the other person at like at the time I was really big into World of Warcraft and I'd be like I'm going to go play WoW for a couple hours like that's cool right days right and like you have like I have to kind of get over almost like asking for permission and after a while you're like oh no wait it's just I'm just going to go do that we're just sharing this living there's nothing weird about that but that's a really weird thing for people to kind of understand right is that when you're like when you're in relationship so much of your time and so much of the logistics have to be figured out so you have to talk constantly and say I'm going to go hang out with the guys because you're actually sacrificing the time with your significant other you're going to be spending a lot of time together so you got to just get through what Gus

and you actually have to make sure that you know the difference between those two things because it's very, very, very important. Like I don't know if you've noticed that in your relationship, but when you're just sitting there watching TV and she's reading a magazine and you're just you know hanging out on the internet and something's on that's fun, it's relaxing, but it's not the same as you guys sitting together having dinner talking about your days like actually decompressing and remembering that you love each other and you're in each other's lives or like engaging in an actual uh conversation as opposed to just like talking right, like, small talk, right. And so that's that's the craziest thing is like my wife and I have to actually sit down and turn the TV off get a meal together and talk to each other and it sounds stupid to say but that's very, very, very important well in terms of the space stuff then like do you think it's important to have a a man cave style thing going

talk to each other and it sounds stupid to say but that's very very very important well in terms of the the space stuff then like do you think it's important to have a a man cave style thing going on uh I don't think I hate the term "man cave" uh I mean I've just got like for me I've just got um my my computer desk like it's like my PC game uh I got an Xbox and PlayStation there it's like like that's where all my stuff is it's like guess not a man cave it's like it's right next to it's where every everything else is it's just like yeah that's like where all the clutter you don't want in other parts like that's all just where it goes and like that's that's what I'll deal with I mean I have a little bit of a man cave I don't necessarily think of it as my for solitude or anything like that but I think less important of the physical space is actually the mental space of like saying I'm going to go like sometimes I just like to go for a while go to

for the solitude or anything like that, but I think less important of the physical space is actually the mental space of like saying I'm going to go... sometimes I just like to go for a while, go to Starbucks and sit and read the internet or read a book right, and that needs to be okay, the other person needs to be okay with you taking time for yourself, and I don't think there's anything wrong with that.
